text: this is matt zoller seitz for the new
york times in the history movie comedy
airplane represents the moment when
everything got a lot faster it's very
much in the tradition of the anarchy
spirit of comedy which is represented by
the likes of the Marx Brothers and
Laurel and Hardy and particularly WC
Fields whose movies like never give a
sucker an even break we're just about as
close to pure surrealism as American
Studios ever produced this was what I
like to call the dumpster school of
comedy which is it contains anything and
everything and you can just kind of
remand until you find something that you
personally find amusing the movie was
co-directed by a team known as Z a Z
which stands for Jerry Zucker his
brother David Zucker and jim abrahams
they come out of a counterculture
tradition of comedy you can see that
spirit translate into their their first
film that they wrote together kentucky
fried movie which was directed by john
landis that one is literally structured
to suggest that you are sitting there
watching TV late at night and just
vegging out airplane which was their
their first movie actually directing
mixes the kind of very dry verbal humor
with really crazy visual sight gags and
sometimes they do both in the same frame
like you might see a couple of people
having a conversation and the foreground
that's quite silly in its own right
while in the background something just
completely demented is happening Zucker
Abrams occur also cited Mad Magazine as
an influence and if you look at Mad
Magazine you can see a similar aesthetic
being practiced airplane was the most
successful comedy release up to that
point and from that point forward there
was a new template for comedy was that
gag a minute densely packed you can't
absorb it all in one sitting school of
comedy you can also see the influence
reflected elsewhere in popular culture
particularly in some of the animated
shows that came along in the 80s after Z
a Z came in the Simpsons and South Park
and family guy to name just three also
operate in this kind of airplane
tradition trying to see how much they
can put into 22 minutes plus commercials
the track record of movies has not been
quite
good unless Z a Z was associated with
them movies films like date movie and
epic movie and the scary movie franchise
which david zucker himself directed a
couple of segments of have their moments
but they are nothing near the kind of
level of delirium that you get from Z a
Z at their best they had their own thing
going on and they did it better than
almost anybody for the new york times
i'm matt zoller seitz
